# Creating the sticker

This is a short tutorial to easily create your own stickers!

Let's give it a try for this group and find our identity! ðŸ™ƒ

## 00. Libraries

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(magick)
library(hexSticker)
library(sysfonts)

```
# Example defining palette
```{r}
party_colors <- c("red","blue")
```


## 01. Prepare images

```{r}
image_networking <- magick::image_read('../images/networking.png')
hub <- magick::image_read("../images/hub.png")
calendar <- magick::image_read('../images/calendar.png')
dinosaur <- magick::image_read('../images/dinosaur.png')
footprint <- magick::image_read('../images/footprint.png')

```

## 02. Load fonts

```{r}

fonts <- font_files()

# Check font paths
# font_paths()

# Add the font we want
font_add(family = "Bahnschrift", regular = "C:\\Windows\\Fonts\\bahnschrift.ttf")

```

# Defininf color pallete

```{r}
party_color = list(red = "red", "blue")

```


## 03. Stickers

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

statshub <- sticker(
  # Title
  package = "Stats-Hub",
  # Title attributes
  p_family = "Bahnschrift",
  p_color = '#192a51',
  p_size = 20,
  p_y = 1.5,
  # Image
  subplot = hub,
  # Image attributes
  s_width = 1,
  s_height = 1,
  s_x = 1,
  s_y = 0.85,
  # Hexagon attributes
  h_fill = '#faf9f9',
  h_color = '#3a506b',
  h_size = 1.5,
  # Add a link
  url = "FALL 2022",
  u_size = 5,
  u_color = '#003f88',
  # Add spotlight
  spotlight = F,
  # Spotlight attributes
  l_y = 1,
  l_x = 1,
  l_width = 3,
  l_height = 3,
  l_alpha = 0.3,
  # File saving
  filename = "statshub_logo.png",
  dpi = 300,
  white_around_sticker = FALSE
  ) 

```

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false

tidymonday <- sticker(
  # Title

```
